channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Living on a Landslide: In a California Town, Shifting Ground Is Threatening Homes
item.description: Worsening conditions in Rancho Palos Verdes prompted officials to shut off electricity in one community. But as the city searches for solutions, many ...

item.title: Live Updates: Brief Labor Strike in Israel Lays Bare Anger Over Hostage Killings
item.description: Thousands of workers walked off the job in outrage over the deaths of hostages in Gaza, as protesters demanded that Israel reach a deal with Hamas. Pr...

item.title: Russia Hits Ukraine With Wave of Strikes as School Year Opens
item.description: The attack, the third large-scale bombardment in a week, coincided with intense fighting in eastern Ukraine and Russia.

item.title: The Quiet Collaboration Between Paralympic Athletes and Their Assistants
item.description: For competition partners who share the mutual goal of winning medals, eye contact or a simple touch can be all the communication that’s needed.

item.title: Fraternity Brothers Balk at a $515,000 Party for Defending the Flag
item.description: After students at the University of North Carolina shielded a U.S. flag from protesters, admirers raised money to throw a ‘rager’ in their honor. Some...

item.title: Russia Hits Ukraine With Wave of Strikes as School Year Opens
item.description: The attack, the third large-scale bombardment in a week, coincided with intense fighting in eastern Ukraine and Russia.

item.title: Biden Says Netanyahu Is Not Doing Enough to Free Israeli Hostages
item.description: The president told reporters he would have more to say after a meeting later Monday in the White House Situation Room.

item.title: Biden Says Netanyahu Is Not Doing Enough to Free Israeli Hostages
item.description: The president told reporters he would have more to say after a meeting later Monday in the White House Situation Room.

item.title: Climate Change Can Cause Bridges to ‘Fall Apart Like Tinkertoys,’ Experts Say
item.description: Extreme heat and flooding are accelerating the deterioration of bridges, engineers say, posting a quiet but growing threat.

item.title: Gao Zhen, Artist Who Critiqued the Cultural Revolution, Is Detained in China
item.description: Mr. Gao is being held on suspicion of slandering China’s heroes and martyrs, an offense punishable by up to three years in prison, his brother said.
